'John Winston Ono Lennon', (born 'John Winston Lennon'; 9 October 1940 â 8
December 1980) was an English musician, singer and songwriter who rose to
worldwide fame as a founder member  of the
Beatles, the most commercially successful and critically acclaimed band in the
history of popular music. With Paul McCartney, he formed a songwriting
partnership that is the most celebrated of the 20th century.

Born and raised in Liverpool, as a teenager Lennon became involved in the
skiffle craze; his first band, the Quarrymen, evolved into The Beatles in 1960.
When the group disbanded in 1970, Lennon embarked on a solo career that produced
the critically acclaimed albums [[John Lennon/Plastic Ono Band]] and [[Imagine
(album)|Imagine]], and iconic songs such as
